title: Fighting misinformation
thankYouMessage: Thank you so much for your donation. Public support is essential in challenging the negative narrative around fact checking, and in reducing the harm caused by misinformation. You can donate again at any time, including via Direct Debit, by visiting our website: fullfact.org/donate.
summary: Misinformation ruins lives, damages people’s health and promotes hate. As Full Fact's team continues to fight the causes and consequences of misinformation, the rise of a harmful new narrative equating fact checking with censorship is making public support for fact checkers more critical than ever.
solution:
We have been vocal in opposing the current narrative. We’re an impartial charity, but we will not be impartial about the principle that facts matter.

We fact check claims made by politicians, public institutions and journalists, and viral online content; giving millions access to the truth. By asking people to correct the record when they get things wrong, and by developing world-leading technology to tackle misinformation on a global scale, we reduce its spread and the harm it causes.
problem:
The impact of misinformation is felt by everyone. When our politicians and media make and share falsehoods, and when misleading information is spread online, we all suffer.

This year, we've seen increasing hostility from the US government towards fact checking, and this has led to major internet companies reducing their support. These worrying developments mean the work of fact checkers is even more important.
impactSummary:
You donation will:

Bolster our resilience in the face of the new negative narrative around fact checking. 

Provide people across the UK with access to the good information they need to make informed decisions on the issues that matter to them; whether that’s on their health, their finances, or their vote.

Raise standards in Parliament and stop politicians and journalists from making inaccurate claims; promoting a culture of accuracy for a fairer public debate.
impactReporting:
We keep detailed records of how many people we reach, the numbers of fact checks we publish, how many correction requests we place, and how many are acted upon.

In addition we regularly report on our work in our weekly newsletters to supporters, and commission polls and surveys on how the general public reacts to misinformation over time.

budgetDetails.description: to be a leading voice for fact checking both nationally and globally.
to fact check politicians and the media and stop the spread of harmful misinformation.
to build capacity for working in defined areas like health and climate.
to monitor government progress against manifesto pledges.

alternativeFundUse: If the campaign target is not met we will continue to raise funds from other sources. These will be used to further the aims above. We are confident that all funds will be able to be spent to further these aims, even if specific activities are changed or adapted.
aims: We will continue to fact check at scale the claims of politicians from all parties and work constructively with MPs to ensure corrections are made, and misinformation does not spread further.

We will continue to be a voice for the principle that facts matter in the face of the negative narrative  emanating from the US administration and big internet companies. Donations will help secure Full Fact’s work as internet companies withdraw from funding independent fact checkers.
Full Fact’s Government Tracker will continue to monitor the government’s progress against the pledges made in the Labour Party manifesto, reporting what we find to the public.
We will continue to build our focus in specific areas where the debate is highly politicised and prone to misinformation - like climate and decarbonisation, immigration, and health.
